title: High Dependency on UN Aid
description: In 2021, Sudan received over $1.78 million in net official flows from UN agencies, highlighting its reliance on international aid for economic support.

title: Elevated Inflation Levels
description: Sudan's Consumer Price Index reached an alarming 38,796.56 in 2022, indicating severe inflationary pressures within the economy.

title: High Gross National Expenditure Deflator
description: In 2023, Sudan's gross national expenditure deflator was recorded at 436,517.06, suggesting significant price level changes in the economy.

title: Skyrocketing GDP Deflator
description: The GDP deflator for Sudan in 2023 was 462,510.92, indicating substantial inflation and economic instability.

title: High Tariff Rates on Manufactured Goods
description: Sudan imposed a 26.8% tariff rate on manufactured products in 2021, potentially hindering trade and economic growth.

title: Broad Money to Total Reserves Ratio Concerns
description: In 2017, Sudan's broad money to total reserves ratio was 54.43, indicating potential vulnerabilities in financial stability.

title: Lowest GDP Growth Rate
description: In 2023, Sudan experienced a GDP growth rate of -20.11%, indicating a significant economic contraction.

title: Minimal GDP Per Capita
description: Sudan's GDP per capita was recorded at 311.38 constant LCU in 2023, one of the lowest globally.

title: Lowest GNI Growth Rate
description: The GNI growth rate for Sudan in 2023 was -19.06%, reflecting a severe decline in national income.

title: Minimal Vitamin A Supplementation Coverage
description: In 2022, only 1% of children aged 6-59 months in Sudan received Vitamin A supplementation.

title: Lowest Total Reserves as a Percentage of External Debt
description: In 2017, Sudan's total reserves were only 0.81% of its total external debt, indicating limited financial buffers.

title: Minimal Exports Contribution to GDP
description: Exports of goods and services accounted for only 1.11% of Sudan's GDP in 2023, highlighting a weak export sector.

title: Low Efficiency in Revenue Mobilization
description: Sudan's CPIA efficiency of revenue mobilization rating was 2 in 2023, indicating challenges in effective revenue collection.

title: Low Equity in Public Resource Use
description: In 2023, Sudan's CPIA equity of public resource use rating was 1.5, suggesting significant inequities in resource distribution.

title: Minimal Alcohol Consumption
description: In 2020, Sudan had one of the lowest alcohol consumption rates globally, with only 0.01 liters per capita.

title: Low International Tourism Expenditure
description: International tourism expenditures accounted for just 0.16% of Sudan's total imports in 2018, indicating a limited tourism sector.
